剝.definition: to peel; to skin; to flay; to shuck

剝奪.definition: to deprive; to expropriate; to strip (sb of his property)

剝掉.definition: to peel off; to strip off

剝皮.definition: to skin; to flay; to peel; (fig.) (coll.) to haul (sb) over the coals; also pr. [bo1pi2]

剝蝕.definition: to corrode; to expose by corrosion (geology)

剝離.definition: to peel; to strip; to peel off; to come off (of tissue, skin, covering etc)
